• Cook the Spaghetti noodles according to package instructions. Once cooked, transfer to a bowl. Set aside. 
• Heat the oil in a Pan. 
• Saute the onion and garlic. 
• Once the onions becomes soft, add the ground pork. Cook until the color turns light brown. 
• Add the luncheon meat and hotdog. Stir and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. 
• Pour-in the Spaghetti sauce and beef broth. Stir and let boil. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. 
• Try to taste the sauce and add salt and pepper if needed. 
• Pour the Filipino Style Spaghetti sauce over the Spaghetti. Top with shredded cheese.

• Mix 1 cup takoyaki flour with 2 cups dashi stock to create a smooth batter. 
• Preheat a takoyaki pan and grease the molds with cooking oil. 
• Pour the batter into the molds, add diced octopus, green onions, tenkasu, and pickled ginger. 
• Cook on medium heat until the edges start to firm up. 
• Using a skewer, flip the partially cooked takoyaki to form a ball shape. 
• Cook until golden brown and crispy on all sides. 
• Drizzle with takoyaki sauce and mayonnaise. 
• Garnish with bonito flakes and aonori before serving.

• Boil yakisoba noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside. 
• Heat oil in a pan and stir-fry sliced pork or your preferred protein until cooked. 
• Add julienned vegetables (cabbage, carrots, and onions) to the pan and saut√© until tender. 
• Push the cooked ingredients to one side of the pan and add more oil, then stir in the cooked noodles. 
• Pour yakisoba sauce over the noodles and toss everything together until well coated. 
• Continue cooking until the noodles are heated through and slightly crispy. 
• Garnish with chopped green onions and pickled red ginger.

• Mix 2 cups glutinous rice flour with 1 cup water to form a sticky rice dough. 
• Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into flat, round discs. 
• Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. 
• Place the rice discs on the skillet and cook until the bottoms are golden brown. 
• Flip the discs and cook the other side until crispy and lightly browned. 
• Remove from heat and let them cool slightly. 
• Optionally, brush the senbei with soy sauce or your preferred seasoning for flavor. 
• Allow the senbei to cool completely before storing in an airtight container.

• Boil ramen noodles in water according to package instructions, then drain and set aside. 
• In a pot, heat a flavorful broth (chicken, beef, or vegetable) until simmering. 
• Cook protein of choice (sliced pork, chicken, tofu) in the broth until fully cooked. 
• Add ramen noodles to the broth, stirring gently to separate. 
• Mix in vegetables like bok choy, mushrooms, and green onions, cooking until tender. 
• Season with soy sauce, miso, or your preferred ramen seasoning to taste. 
• Ladle the ramen into bowls, ensuring a balance of noodles, broth, and toppings. 
• Garnish with a soft-boiled egg, nori strips, and sesame seeds before serving.

• Cook short-grain sushi rice according to package instructions and let it cool slightly. 
• Wet your hands and sprinkle them with salt to prevent sticking. 
• Take a handful of rice and form it into a triangular or oval shape in your palm. 
• Create an indentation in the center and add a filling such as grilled salmon, pickled plum, or seasoned seaweed. 
• Cover the filling with more rice, shaping and pressing to form a compact triangle or oval. 
• Optional: Wrap the onigiri with a strip of nori for added flavor and easy handling. 
• Repeat the process for additional onigiri, keeping hands moistened to prevent sticking.

• In a blender, combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, 2 tablespoons melted butter, and a pinch of salt until smooth. 
• Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil. 
• Pour a small amount of batter into the pan, swirling to coat the bottom evenly. 
• Cook until the edges lift, then flip the crepe and cook the other side briefly. 
• Repeat until the batter is finished, stacking the crepes on a plate. 
• Fill each crepe with your desired sweet or savory filling, like Nutella, strawberries, or ham and cheese. 
• Fold or roll the crepes and serve warm. 
• Optionally, dust with powdered sugar or drizzle with chocolate for added sweetness.
